meanings.definition: A person who is considered strange or eccentric.
meanings.sent1: The oddball in our class always wears mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: She stood out as an oddball with her quirky sense of style.
meanings.sent3: The oddball at the party told jokes that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: He was the oddball of the family, always marching to the beat of his own drum.
meanings.sent5: The oddball's unique perspective brought a fresh outlook to the team.

meanings.definition: Something that is unusual or out of the ordinary.
meanings.sent1: The antique shop had an oddball collection of vintage toys.
meanings.sent2: Finding a purple carrot in the garden was quite an oddball discovery.
meanings.sent3: The oddball item on the menu turned out to be a surprisingly tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The old clock chimed an oddball tune that echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: Among the sea of black umbrellas, her bright yellow one was an oddball choice.
